DataElement.preferredDefinition: a description of the reproductive status of a woman as indicated by start of menopause.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: refers to the menopause status of a person.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: (MEN-o-pawz) The time of life when a woman's menstrual periods stop permanently. Also called "change of life."

Concepts.definition: The permanent cessation of menses, usually defined by 6 to 12 months of amenorrhea in a woman over 45 years of age.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a description of the reproductive status of a woman as indicated by start of menopause.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the time before menopause. Menopause ("change of life") is the time of life when a woman's menstrual periods stop permanently.: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status.: No Value Exists: Subsequent to; after.: The first day of the female's last menstrual cycle.: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: Earlier in time or order.: Surgery to remove both ovaries.: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: A surgical procedure to remove the uterine body (partial hysterectomy) or the uterine body and cervix (total hysterectomy).

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status.
A period of time of twelve months.
The date of the first day of the most recent menstrual cycle.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
A surgical procedure to remove the uterine body (partial hysterectomy) or the uterine body and cervix (total hysterectomy).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the patient's ability to conceive or nurse offspring and/or their current reproductive status.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: (MEN-o-pawz) The time of life when a woman's menstrual periods stop permanently. Also called "change of life.":Category; used informally to mean a class of things.

Concepts.definition: The permanent cessation of menses, usually defined by 6 to 12 months of amenorrhea in a woman over 45 years of age.
A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.
